tagged_story_for_tts:
"Fingers—ten slender architects of silence and storm.

They trace the edges of memory like blind cartographers, pressing into clay, into skin, into the cold hum of piano keys half-remembered. Each knuckle a tiny altar: cracked cuticles whispering secrets to the wind, nails moon-pale and chipped from digging into the wrong kind of earth. The index, accusatory, points at ghosts; the middle, stubborn, refuses to bend for kings. Thumbs—thick and clumsy—roll the world’s weight between them, crushing sugar cubes of time.

They build and unbuild: cathedrals of smoke, castles in spilled salt, the fragile lattice of a lover’s spine. At night, they twitch with the syntax of dreams, signing in a language older than speech. Blood pulses beneath—rivers mapping the distance between almost and never. And when they curl into fists? Oh. Then they hold entire universes in the dark, just to prove they can."
